messages.content: ComfyUI-Stereopsis is an initiative to integrate a stereopsis effect within ComfyUI, by processing a series of sequential images through the Side-by-Side node and applying Frame Delay to one of the inputs.
What applications does the stereopsis effect support?
The stereopsis effect is compatible with any Virtual Reality headset that supports Side-by-Side (SBS) video playback, offering a practical application in immersive media experiences.
What does the Side-by-Side module do?
The Side-by-Side module is a utility designed for concatenating two images side by side into a single image.
What are the input requirements for the Side-by-Side module?

The Side-by-Side module requires two inputs, each labeled as left_image and right_image. Both inputs are expected to be images, represented as PyTorch tensors, with no restriction on the images' width but requiring them to have the same height and channel depth.
What does the Frame Delay module do?
The FrameDelay module offers a sophisticated solution for manipulating image batches by repeating and inserting frames, thereby introducing a delay effect without altering the overall batch size.
What are the input types for the Frame Delay module?
The FrameDelay module accepts an image batch as input along with parameters to select the frame (selected_frame) and define the delay (frame_delay).
What is the programming language used for these modules?
Both the Side-by-Side and Frame Delay modules are implemented in Python using the PyTorch library.
What are the requirements for using the Side-by-Side and Frame Delay modules?
To use the Side-by-Side and Frame Delay modules, PyTorch needs to be installed and configured in the working environment.
